body.name: Jetboil Genesis Basecamp Backpacking and Camping Stove Cooking System with Camping Cookware
body.stockDetail: Only 16 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 2 hrs 25 mins
features: Jetboil's Genesis Basecamp portable propane stove features a dual-burner design that functions as a standalone camping stove or couples with other Jetlink-compatible stoves or a Luna satellite burner to create an outdoor cooking range.

The system's 5-liter Jetboil FluxRing camping pot with strainer lid, and 10-inch ceramic-coated nonstick fry pan give you everything you need to set a new benchmark for basecamp cooking and all stows neatly in the included travel bag.
Ideal for all of your cooking needs in the outdoors, the beastly 10, 000 BTU heating system also boils water in just over three minutes—perfect for melting snow or making coffee.
An attachable windscreen improves the system's performance in any weather; regulated for consistent performance down to 20 degrees F (-6 degrees C).

Includes: Compact folding 2 burner camping stove, 10-inch fryPan, 5 Liter FluxPot with strainer lid, and system carrying bag with pocket for regulator; compatible with standard 16.4 ounce propane bottle (sold separately); One-year limited warranty.
Measures: packed - 10.3 in x 7.2 in (262 mm x 183 mm); open - 20.5 in x 9.8 in (52.1 cm x 24.9 cm); weighs 9.1 lbs. (4.1 kg).
Ideal for: Backpacking, Camping, Camp Cooking, Basecamp Cooking, Overland Camping, Van Camping, RV Camping, Survival Camping, and Emergency Use.
Only use outdoors in a well-ventilated area.

For any adventure—from alpine expedition to a weekend trek—Jetboil offers a stove that will keep you fueled. When exploring the backcountry, a compact and efficient stove is fundamental, no matter the level of cuisine you want to create.
Compatible with standard 16.4 oz propane bottle

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Jetboil Genesis Basecamp Cooking System The Ultimate All-In-One Backcountry Cooking System The Genesis Basecamp System stows neatly into itself and then fits snugly into the durable and convenient travel bag. In one fell swoop you can pick up the regulated Genesis stove, 5-liter FluxPot, and Fry Pan—everything you need to set a new benchmark for basecamp cooking. The compact, folding two-burner camping stove delivers 10,000 British Thermal Units (BTU) of cooking power and an incremental heat output that can go from a simmer to a rolling boil. A JetLink output port allows additional stoves to be daisy-chained together to create the ultimate camp chef stove. An attachable windscreen protects the flame and improves performance in any weather. The Genesis Basecamp Stove is compatible with standard 16.4-ounce propane bottles. In 2001, Dwight Aspinwall and Perry Dowst revolutionized backcountry cooking by creating a fast, compact and efficient stove unlike anything the world had ever seen—the first-ever Jetboil. And our engineers have been following in their footsteps ever since, relentlessly pushing the limits of what’s possible by inventing technologies that continue to redefine the industry. Features Fast and efficient folding two-burner propane stove Unbeatable simmer control Convenient, reliable lever igniter Easy to clean 5L FluxPot with strainer lid 10” ceramic coated non-stick fry pan System carrying bag (8.5" tall x 10.75") with pocket for fuel regulator JetLink fuel output port

Massively Compact Cooking System Compact and Rugged The Genesis camping stove is lightweight and folds in half for easy travel. The outer case is made of rugged steel and is built to take whatever Mother Nature can throw at it. Reliable and Versatile The Genesis Basecamp Stove's two propane burners feature convenient, reliable lever igniters and separate output dials for maximum flexibility. The stove is designed specifically for Jetboil's FluxRing 5-liter pot and 10-inch skillet, both included. Stows Conveniently The Jetboil Basecamp System stows neatly into itself. The stove nests inside the 5L cookpot and the fry pan stacks on top, all fitting snugly into the durable travel bag, including a pocket for the regulator. Expandable Expand your cooking options with the JetLink accessory port. Attach the Luna accessory burner (sold separately), or daisy-chain multiple stoves together for the ultimate camp chef stove.

Genesis Basecamp System Genesis Basecamp Stove HalfGen Basecamp System Number of Burners 2 2 1 Power 10,000 BTU/hour (3 kilowatts) 10,000 BTU/hour (3 kilowatts) 10,000 BTU/hour (3 kilowatts) Boil Time 3 minutes 15 seconds per 1-liter in 5-liter Flux Pot (average over life of 1-pound propane can) 3 minutes 15 seconds per 1-liter in 5-liter Flux Pot (average over life of 1-pound propane can) 3 minutes 15 seconds per 1-liter in 5-liter Flux Pot (average over life of 1-pound propane can) Water Boiled 48 liters per 1-pound propane bottle 48 liters per 1-pound propane bottle 48 liters per 1-pound propane bottle Fuel Regulator ✓ ✓ ✓ Group Size 3-5 People 3-5 People 1-4 People Volume Open Platform Open Platform Open Platform Weight 9.1 pounds (4.1 kilograms) 6.2 pounds (2.8 kilograms) 3.5 pounds (1.6 kilograms)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use - fantastic heat output
reviews.reviewText: Very compact - well designed. Easy to start and control heat. Easy to clean. Surface area of grates can be a little tricky with some pans or coffee pots. Great with Luna for coffee making. Durable - one of the best purchases made recently for the camp kitchen. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Premium Camping Stove Worth Every Penny
reviews.reviewText: The Jetboil Genesis Basecamp Backpacking and Camping Stove Cooking System is a remarkable piece of outdoor equipment that has impressed me and those around me. Here's why it's my top pick for a camping stove:Superior Functionality: This stove offers exceptional performance for all my camping cooking needs. Its efficiency and reliability make it stand out from other stoves in the market.Attention-Grabber: Everywhere I take it, people are drawn to this stove. Its quality and features are evident, and it has become a conversation starter during my trips.Price Tag: While the price may be on the higher side, it's an investment that pays off in functionality and satisfaction. It's a premium product that delivers premium results, making the price more than justifiable.An Essential Piece of Camping Gear: It's not just a stove; it's an essential part of my camping gear. Its value and performance have made it indispensable for my outdoor adventures.Minor Concern - Cost: The price might be a barrier for some potential buyers. However, for those who can afford it, the investment is worth every cent.Summary: The Jetboil Genesis Basecamp Backpacking and Camping Stove Cooking System is a top-of-the-line camping stove that is worth every penny. If you're looking for a high-quality, efficient, and reliable cooking system for your outdoor expeditions, this is the stove to go for. While the price might be a concern for some, its quality and performance justify the investment. It's become an essential part of my camping experience, and I highly recommend it to fellow outdoor enthusiasts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We love glamping but like to grill out doors. We actually bought a cheap gas grill but the legs kept slipping out which is not a safe thing!. We found this item and it is really cool. It is real compact and easy to carry. It is a bit heavy, but it really is worth it. It is expensive but the convenience of it and it has its own pot and pan is worth it. Each burner was easy to light and control the flame. The pans are non stick and cleaned up easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely great car camping stove
reviews.reviewText: I have used this stove a few times since purchasing it. Here are a few thoughts.Pros1. It is very compact and easy to transport. Takes up very little packing space. I actually take it with me when I go on day fishing trips and I can easily take it out and make lunch on my tailgate.2. Easy to control the heat. The knobs for gas control make it very easy to control the flow and thus the heat very precisely.3. It is very well made. My buddies all have the Coleman stove that is similar and now are drooling over this.4. I haven’t yet found the need to, but it is expandable.Cons1. I actually read this before buying it and found that with the stove directly in the pots it actually can scratch and damage the pots, so I followed one bit of advice and just put an old dish towel in around the stove to protect the pot.2. The windscreen is a little difficult to use and I feel as though it might just blow away in the wind it is trying to block.Other observations1. One other camper that I was with last weekend made the comment that you can’t put a griddle on it like you can a Coleman two burner stove or a camp chef. My response to that was, if I am going to be cooking for enough people that I really need a griddle like that, then I will just bring my camp chef. Otherwise, when cooking for myself and my family of 5, this works perfectly. It was never intended to compete with the camp chef line of stoves anyway.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jet broil Basecamp System
reviews.reviewText: Compact and easy to use. Perfect stove for overlanding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Could be $100 less
reviews.reviewText: picked up the Genesis as a way to make my pack out a little smaller over my current stove setup. its nice and compact how everything fits together. i like the pan but i think the pot is a little too big for most camp needs. I see the reason behind it though as it allows for everything to be all in one piece. i do find myself taking an additional smaller pot to cook with as im not making family sized meals. the flame is kind of annoying as you have to spin it several times to even get it to light. the caveat is that you have more adjustability to control your flame other than just being on and off. what i find annoying is in brighter settings i cant see where the flame is - i guess i can try to count the turns? anyway, its a nice compact size but should be $100 less than what i bought at. that price is more reasonable in my eyes. YMMV

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You are buying a product from a company that has great customer service.
reviews.reviewText: Unfortunately, my strap broke, so contacted their customer service via email. Within few hours, I received first email asking my information, dates of purchase, location and model #. Second email came less than 2 hours and telling me they will ship the replacement part first thing tomorrow. just WOW. I feel great that I have purchased a product from company with great customer service. Great job Brenda from Johnson Outdoors!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. This feels like a high quality build. The amount of control with the burners is rather good. Only thing I don't like is the flimsy wind gaurd.

Pagas el diseño y lo práctico para su trasporte y uso. (Pues es más caro que la competencia) se ha usado una vez al momento. Viene con olla y sartén en cuales entran y funcionan como funda aunado a su bolsa de traslado para que no se maltrate.Funciona con tanque standar de 16 OZ. Él columna verde para ser exacto.trae encendedor., 2 flama muy buenas que pueden funcionar a la par. Trae su regulador Rígido. Se puede conectar a un tanque de 10 kg con manguera/ adapador(se vende por separado)Es de recalcar la velocidad con la que calienta esto sobre todo con las ollas y sartén que incluye( pues son especiales para dicha base).Trae el puerto jet link en el cual puedes conectar otra estufa de la misma marca o en su defecto una extensión de la misma marca con un quemador que se llama luna(se vende por separado) pero que desgraciadamente solo es para productos jet Boil, igual se vende acaparador para sentar ollas estándar.( se vende por separado todo)Recomendado si.Caro claro y mucho. Pero hasta el momento consideró que vale la pena. Veremos durabilidad etc.
High grade material, this is top quality, very portable, not heavy. The only downside is the price, this is not cheap.

Although this camp kitchen is quite expensive relative to the competitors equivalents the genesis is excellent quality. I have purchase many different camp cooking options over the years to find what suits me but I wish I had saved the money by purchasing this unit at the start. I am yet to see how the pot and pan wear stands up to long term use.
Lightweight and even better than I expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gas line severed inside, Regulator missing, only one knob turns off. Product unuseable!
reviews.reviewText: How is this product useable when it doesn’t come with the regulator?
